dict.acceptation: 战胜，克服；压倒，制服，…不堪；
被（烟、感情等）熏[压]倒，使受不了；

sent.orig: Gad, a troop shall overcome him: but he shall overcome at the last.
sent.trans: 迦得必被敌军追逼，他却要追逼他们的脚跟。

sent.orig: Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good.
sent.trans: 你不可为恶所胜，反要以善胜恶。

sent.orig: After being overcome, subjectivism and sectarianism crop up again and have to be overcome again.
sent.trans: 这两个东西，扫了又发生，发生了又要扫。

sent.orig: Markets can overcome thinness, the paper says; they can also overcome illegality.
sent.trans: 文章指出，市场可以战胜不景气，也可以克服非法性。

sent.orig: Did his old selfish love of comfort overcome him?
sent.trans: 是他从前爱舒服的那种自私情绪支配了他吗？
